Instructions of use (exclusive for Yinge sb):

INFO: 

I) File 1: bones.npy:
	--> Contains a numpy array with: 
		1) Index of each Bone in the model 
		2) Position in X 
		3) Position in Y 
		4) Position in Z

		Use this file for face expressions 
		
		* NOTE: All numbers are float type, therefore, index 11 would look like 1.1, index 22 would be 2.2... etc. 
			[ 1.70000000e+01 -7.44318902e-01  8.60442936e-01  1.64417875e+00] : index 17, position in x, y and z.

		* NOTE 2: There are some bones that you won't use as they're part of the program. For example, Camera, Light, etc... 
		
		* NOTE 3: unnecessary bones --> all bones with tongue and teeth names.

		TERMINOLOGY: 	

			- Eyeball: Left Eye 
			- Eyeball.001: Right Eye 
			- Eyelid Bottom Left: Eyelid Bottom Left
			- Eyelid Bottom Left.001: Eyelid Bottom right
			- Eyelid Bottom Left.002: Eyelid Top Left 
			- Eyelid Bottom Left.003: Eyelid Top Right
			- Head: the entire head as one bone 
			- Head and Face Bones: General bones of the face (entire model) 
 			- Left: Bone that controls the left eye movement (IMPORTANT)
 			- Right: Bone that controls the right eye movement (IMPORTANT)  
			- Top: Bone that controls the blinking of the left eye (IMPORTANT)
			- Top.001: Bone that controls the blinking of the right eye (IMPORTANT)
			- Main Rig: All Muscles to control expressions
			- WGT-rig: muscles of the face. Change their positions to control the pig's expressions: 
					Example: WGT-rig_brow.B.L --> Left eye brow (1 vertex... 4 in total for eyebrows) 

			* NOTE: for eye movement and blinking, ONLY USE --> Left, Right, Top and Top.001
			 
		
			
	  
II) File 2: vertex.npy: 
	--> Contains a numpy array with: 
		1) Index of each vertex for the pig creation
		2) Position in X 
		3) Position in Y 
		4) Position in Z

		Use this file if you want to draw the pig. 

		* NOTE: Same as the first file, the indices are saved as float type. 
	 


***************************************************
Bones Collection Length: 108
